dialogues.speaker: CREDIT SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: The image is in black and white. The sun disappears behind arid cliffs which cast giant shadows on the sea. A little boy around 8 years old -- tanned from head to to -- sprints along the cliffs, scrambles from one rock to another with amazing agility. In one hand, he carries a transparent plastic bag.  In th other, a net bag containing flippers, mask, pants and sweater. The only thing that slows him down is his bathing suit -- obvious hand-me-downs -- way too big.  He tugs on them as he goes, holding them up... Until they slide again... as he leaps again... and pulls them up... The little boy is JACQUES MAYOL. End credits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES reaches a ledge jutting out over a deserted cove. He spits in his mask... expertly spreads the spit with a finger... locks his feet into the flippers... and dives. He surfaces a long way out... adjusts his mask... and swims away from shore.

dialogues.speaker: IN OPEN SEA
dialogues.text: The boy stops swimming -- starts to gulp air -- sucks it in -- oxygenating his blood in a series of deep rapid breaths -- almost hyperventilating, almost alarming if we've never seen this before. His gaze is glued to the ocean floor.  Clear clear water. 40 feet deep.  And intensely blue. Suddenly, he catches his breath and dives -- into the blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES touches bottom.  Clamps his legs around a rock to hold himself down.  Unhurried, thoroughly at home, 40 fee under... he opens the plastic bag.  A huge speckled moray eel appears in a hole in the rock, slithers toward him. The carnivore's jaws are bigger than the boy's head. The boy smiles at him.  Pulls a piece of raw meat out of his bag and holds it out.  The eel takes the morsel delicately -- and slithers back into his hole. Gravely, JACQUES takes another morsel out of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES walks up a steep road bordering the port, almost dry now. Two boys about his age run up the streets; call out, catc up with him and gesture toward the port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques!  Come quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little boys tug JACQUES to the end of the pier and point to something in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!  Right there!  It's shining! JACQUES walks over, and sure enough sees something shinin a few feet down in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squinting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar! Camera pans and we see a middle-aged PRIEST loading supplies into a small boat.  He stops to watch the children's negotiations.  Little JACQUES is putting his flippers on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.  I'll get it, but no fighting, all right? The two boys nod as they point to the coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll split it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't split a coin.  That's stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.  You're stupid. The pope smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll buy something and split that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want a Ferrari... What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a little radio. The two boys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  We'll decide later.  The light is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the radio from after school, until midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do you stay up until midnight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right... Can I concentrate?  And you can stop pointing.  I've seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen it too. The voice is ENZO'S.  Another young boy wearing little round glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, it's the Italian! He is slightly older than JACQUES but he is taller.  ENZO is with ROBERTO, his younger brother, the only one allowe to carry his flippers.  Five kids are behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it isn't the little Frenchman!  How is the little Frenchman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! ENZO pats JACQUES on the shoulder and leaves his hand there -- a lightly intimidating gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind if I go instead, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intimidated, and pretending not to be)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you did mind, you'd tell me, wouldn't you? ENZO pats his shoulder reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his brother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberto, mio palmo! ROBERTO who has already started to moisten his big brother's gear in the water, holds a pair of dripping flippers and a glistening mask.  The pope watches the scene with obvious pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his brother on the edge of the pier)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count! Sure of himself, ENZO takes a deep breath and dives in th water.  ROBERTO counts out loud.
The kids all walk over to the edge of the pier.  A few feet away, JACQUES takes off his flippers.
ENZO bursts out of the water, the coin in his hand.  The children cheer and clap.  ROBERTO rushes to catch the equipment that comes flying at him, piece by piece. ENZO walks over to JACQUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing him the coin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's is it now?  You saw it but I dove for it! JACQUES doesn't answer. ENZO smiles and slowly puts the coin in his pocket.  He pulls it out again and waves it under JACQUES' nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberto?  How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six seconds. ENZO looks at JACQUES for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll throw it back into the water. You dive and if you do less than six, it's yours. JACQUES doesn't say anything, then finally shakes his head, negatively.  ENZO smiles, taps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brava! The first boy finally sums up his courage to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (timidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo?  I saw the coin first... We split?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't split a coin, stupid. ENZO laughing, sticks the coin in his pocket and leaves the pier with his gang. The pope smiles and pulls a coin from his pocket. With his flippers dangling from one hand, JACQUES sadly stares out at the sea.  The pope calls him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques... Come, look. JACQUES goes over to him, sees where he is pointing, the faint gleam of the coin underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a coin shining down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overjoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.  It's a coin!  I'll get it for you, Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be for the poor. JACQUES, intent on the coin's glimmer, quickly slips on his fins, prepares his mask.  He swims in the water like fish, goes directly to the coin.  Scoops it up, brings it to the surface. He breaks water, waves the coin, looks for the priest and sees he is no longer there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Padre? He looks at the ancient impression on the coin -- "Boy on a Dolphin".

dialogues.speaker: ON JACQUES
dialogues.text: He's swimming near the spot where he fed the moray eel. He senses something behind him and turns around.  He sees a dolphin, still and silent, floating vertically.  It seems to be watching him.  The surprise is such that JACQUES is in a panic, leaps up to the surface...

dialogues.speaker: ON JACQUES
dialogues.text: He bolts upright, as if suddenly awakening from a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BURLY MAN, around fifty, crosses the room in the shadow and throws open the shutters with a bang.  Sunlight pours in.  He walks over to JACQUES' bed in the one room house, and runs his hand through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Come on, time to get up, Jacques! JACQUES rubs his eyes.  His father walks over to a pile o blankets on the floor, on the other side of the room.  He gives the pile a kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming at the top of his lungs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis, wake up! He uncovers a kettle on the fire and ladles up a big bowl of soup for Jacques.  A fifty year old man pokes his head out from under the pile of blankets.  It's UNCLE LOUIS, who is having a very hard time, waking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES bursts out of the house, running.  Diving gear under his arm.  A piece of buttered bread in his mouth. He catches up with his father and UNCLE LOUIS.  They're o a path winding down to the port.  JACQUES slows down abruptly.  Tries to imitate their stride.  The weather is balmy and the sea lies before them, peaceful and blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their boat on the water.  The chug of its ENGINE ECHOES off the cliffs.  A few gulls -- drawn by the sound -- ski the waves of its wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On board.  JACQUES' Father checks the antique air pump. JACQUES polishes the enormous copper diver's helmet and lays out the rest of an old fashioned deep sea diver's suit. At the foot of an old monastery another boat passes. The Priest is in it. JACQUES' Father and LOUIS take off their caps.  JACQUES takes the gold coin out of his pocket. The pope nods to JACQUES.  His father looks over at him without understanding.  The child quickly puts the coin back in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUIS casts anchor.  A few feet away, siting on a rock, the kid with little round glasses is fishing.  He turns around to the boat.  JACQUES smiles and waves at him. ENZO waves back, obviously disturbed in his fishing session.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques, come help me. JACQUES helps his father into the diver's suit.  The burl man struggles into a pair of weighted lead shoes.  He seems sluggish and tired.  JACQUES watches worriedly.  He has a weird feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't dive everyday, Papa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you shouldn't eat everyday, Jacques. His father catches him fondly by the scruff of the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winks at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  When I'm tired down there, the mermaids help me out. Father and son smile at each other.  Then his father puts the helmet on.  JACQUES joins LOUIS at the pump. The heavy diver's suit disappears slowly underwater.  The gleaming copper helmet is the last thing to slide out of sight. JACQUES and LOUIS work the pump.  Regular, steady motions to maintain the flow of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Have you ever seen a mermaid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They keep on pumping for a while, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen them. UNCLE LOUIS goes on.  JACQUES doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to know where? JACQUES looks at the bottom to watch his father. He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: JACQUES' FATHER
dialogues.text: He moves along slowly in his cumbersome diving suit.  He is working the top of a rock outcrop on the sea floor.  H sees a sponge, hooks it; puts it in a bag that's attached to a life line from the boat fastened to his waist.  He moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep up the rhythm.  Sitting on a rock at a distance ENZO watches them.  UNCLE LOUIS is bored stiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I saw the mermaids?!  Why don't you ever ask any question? I'm always the one asking the question!  We're sitting here like two stones and I'm taking to myself. Ask me something, Goddamnit! JACQUES calmly looks over at him, slows down his pumping and almost serenely asks him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a completely flat tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did my mother leave? UNCLE LOUIS seems disturbed by the question.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ill at ease)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on now, pump!

dialogues.speaker: JACQUES' FATHER
dialogues.text: He is walking with difficulty at the bottom.  His bag is full of sponges.  He seems to be having trouble breathing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES and LOUIS are pumping silently.  UNCLE LOUIS feel obliged to answer JACQUES' question. UNCLE LOUIS finally breaks the silence and explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother didn't leave.  She went back to America, that's all.  It's her home.  She's allergic to this Island.  She likes refrigerators and machines that clean the floor... so one day she left.  Woman are like that, unpredictable, like the sea. They haven't been paying attention to the bubbles gushing at the surface.  The air hose is being pulled down in a very worrisome way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a slight grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where did you see mermaids? UNCLE LOUIS smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bars in Athens! Very pleased with himself, UNCLE LOUIS burst out laughing JACQUES shyly shrugs his shoulders.  The air hose is suddenly yanked down.  JACQUES immediately sees all the bubbles.  He is white as a sheet. JACQUES rushes to the side of the boat and starts yelling down at his father.  He grabs the life line and starts pulling at it hysterically.  The air hose snaps and starts flying around like some crazy snake.  JACQUES trie to jump overboard.  UNCLE LOUIS catches hold of his foot at the last second.  JACQUES is slapping the water with his hands, trying to go down but UNCLE LOUIS won't let him.  JACQUES is yelling desperately.  ENZO is now standing on his rock, watching the scene, horrified. The sea now looks as if it were boiling. UNCLE LOUIS grabs hold of JACQUES and hugs him in his arms.  Standing on his rock, ENZO is now crying desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques!  Jacques! The last air bubbles are now breaking on the surface; it looks as if they will never stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image is now in color. A rocky pink cliff over looks the very bright sea which fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSED
dialogues.text: ALFREDO runs (skips) up the cobbled street as fast as he can go, surprisingly fast. He runs to the large terrace of a restaurant which he enters.  We have time to read the sign carrying the restaurant's name:  "LA MAMMA".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALFREDO skips in.  He is panting, covered in sweat.  His panic is palpable.  The whole room watches him approach a long table where a large family is having a birthday part for a very old lady. He has to stop a second and catch his breath before he ca get the words out.  Then leans over and whispers in the ear of a great big man -- around 30 -- built like a bull, wearing little round glasses. The man listens, then stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat-up FIAT, towing an equally beat-up trailer, stops. ENZO unfolds out of the driver's seat, like a circus clow emerging from a toy car. The construction SUPERVISOR, an American, wearing a three piece suit, hurries over to him. ENZO has already started undressing.  ROBERTO unloads the diving gear from the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhausted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signore Molinari?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly undressing, expressionless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The company asked me to extract everything I could from the wreck; so the divers were trying to get at the engine... and then the boat turned over... in the current... and... look, I fucked up!  Can you help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many are, down there? ENZO goes back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one... We're feeding him air, but he's not breathing regularly... You've got to get him out fast. ENZO glances at the map, then at the accident site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lira?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to hold me up at a time like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do understand you're talking to the champion diver of the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but ten thousand dollars... ENZO opens the trunk of his FIAT and pulls out the jack. He slams the trunk shut, and stands looking at the American, straight in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  You tell me.  How much would you say the man's life is worth? Extremely uncomfortable, the SUPERVISOR doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my village, we have a saying: when the wind blows, the flags of all nations flap in the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you should get your checkbook. Damn quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's at the end of the pier, his feet dangling in the muddy water of the port.  A few feet away a pump sends ai HISSING through a rubber tube to the diver trapped below. ENZO inhales steadily, his chest heaving like a bellow. He carefully puts his spectacles inside his shoes, dons his flippers, etc., with his usual flair of suspense. Behind him the SUPERVISOR and other construction workers watch expectantly.  ROBERTO heaves a stone weight into th bay, a cable attached to it plays out from a drum on the pier. ENZO ignoring everyone, grabs the ordinary tire jack, flip-flops over to the now taut cable, the stone has hit bottom.  He takes a deep breath and dives into the bay.

dialogues.speaker: WRECK
dialogues.text: ENZO dives down a chimney of muck.  Picks his way over an around every hazard, until he reaches the diver, trapped under a huge piece of debris. He pats his shoulder to comfort him, he then inserts the tire jack under a piece of concrete... And, as if he were changing a tire, begins to pump the handle... Slowly, in a swirl of mud and water, the chunk of debris rises off the diver's leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is staring at the water silently, suspensefully. The SUPERVISOR has his checkbook in hand, but has completely forgotten it, intent upon what's going on underwater.  ROBERTO taps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since we have a little time, what do you say you write that check?

dialogues.speaker: WRECK
dialogues.text: ENZO cuts the cables tangled around the diver's torso. Then he takes off his flippers, plants his bare feet on the concrete, grabs the diver by the shoulders and pulls him free. The diver drops the air tube and climbs as quickly as possible toward the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diver surfaces, gasping for breath.  A cheer goes up from the crowd.  Several men hurry to pull him onto dry land.  But there is no sign of ENZO.  Everyone waits, breathless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Supervisor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign here. Suddenly, ENZO appears, burst out of the water, holding his flippers up in the air like a trophy.  The onlookers cheer, help him out of the water, slapping him on the back. ENZO tosses the jack and his flippers to ROBERTO. Impassive and silent, he slips his arms into the prize fighter's robe that ROBERTO holds out for him, walks solemnly back to his car. ROBERTO takes the check and walks over to the car.  ENZO bends down into the car and opens the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the open roof smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, thanks a lot.  I mean that too... You extortionist bastard! The car rushes off.  In the distance we see a police (carabinieri) car and an old fire engine rolling in the direction of the construction site.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE FIAT
dialogues.text: ENZO'S car drives past them.  ENZO looks at ROBERTO out o the corner of his eye, then suddenly explodes with joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dollars, Roberto!  We took him for ten thousand dollars! ROBERTO whoops and whistles.  ENZO reaches over and leans on the horn.  The little car races by and finally stops a the top of the cliff facing the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two brothers sit back, relax. Stare out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a while)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo, what are you going to do with the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the car painted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santini will do that for 25 dollars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell him to wax it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo, really.  What are you going to get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rosary for Mama, a dress for Angelica, something with rhine- stones for what's her name, and get yourself a suit that fits... But most important...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the Frenchman.  Find me Mayol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mountain peaks, stark and white.  A winter sky which is strangely and disquietingly dark.  A landscape swept by snow.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSED ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: A yellow light comes out of the storm -- advances toward us.  The headlight of a train. A narrow gauge locomotive steams up grade pushing piles o snow in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the train, leaning against the misty window, JOHANA CROSS, 27, has clear quick charm and a sort of romantic fragility.  She is dressed simply but warmly. She looks through the window; all she sees is white. It is clear that she was not the one who decided on this trip.  Reading the key phrases from a beat-up note book, she calls upon an old Peruvian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the Lago del Demonio? (Es bien aqui el Lago del Demonio) ... Huacracocha? The old man goes into a long, rambling explanation. JOHANA nods without understanding a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train pulls in, slowly pushing piles of snow in front of it and finally stops in front of an old shack which serves as the station. A man, FRANK, bundled in a parka, comes out of a snowmobile parked by the station, and walks up to the train. JOHANA steps down, carrying her suitcase and drops two feet in the snow as she comes off the last step.  FRANK walks over and leans down towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Peru!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK throws the luggage into the back of the snowmobile, jumps in and turns the ignition on.  JOHANA takes her hat scarf and gloves off.  FRANK glances over at her, he is both amused and charmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have a heater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hitting at the dashboard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Sure... Is this your first trip to Peru?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anybody live to make a second? FRANK smiles and kicks the heating system, then leans ove to check it, his eyes off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about the heater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm is at its peak.  The frozen snowmobile plows along side the lake HUACRACOCHA and stops in front of a cluster of quonset huts almost completely buried in snow. FRANK gets the bags out of the back.  The suitcases are b now frozen stiff.  JOHANA follows in his steps. A couple of llamas are huddled up against the hut in attempt to protect themselves from the storm. JOHANA is bewildered.  Shacks in the middle of the Andes, the lake of the "Demon", and now llama that have to be pushed aside to enter one's home. As FRANK opens the door, a man is leaving the hut.  The man is JACQUES MAYOL.  JOHANA and JACQUES pass each other in slow motion.  Everything seems suddenly suspended: time, sound, cold... JACQUES MAYOL instantly makes an impression on her.  He i now 34, still dark-haired, with dark eyes.  He is wearing a red diving suit and a pair of round goggles.  He looks like some legendary creature one would dream about. Everything finally regains its formal speed.  The door slams, the man is gone.  She and FRANK are in the middle of the entrance hall.  JOHANA hasn't yet gotten over the vision she has just had, but she regains composure and enters the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA happily takes her gloves off. FRANK puts down the bags and walks into the next room. It's a sort of laboratory, filled with ultra modern equipment. A big bay window overlooks the lake on which is built a long wooden dock. Sitting in a corner, an old Peruvian man is preparing hot drinks.  JOHANA drops into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drink to warm up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you.  Intravenous if possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling out a flask)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tea... or whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... both.  Did I just see a man in a red suit and goggles? FRANK smiles and pours some whiskey in her tea cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... right. (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Lawrence?  The insurance man... uh... The insurance person is here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time! FRANK smiles and pours JOHANA some tea.  She warms her hands on the cup.  She asks blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be out of place to ask what he's doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy in the Halloween suit! LAWRENCE comes in from the other side of the room. He walks straight over to the bay window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a nice trip?  We were getting restless, it's been three weeks since the accident. JOHANA walks over to the bay window and starts staring at something in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the dock, JACQUES who is sitting on the edg of a hole which is cut in the ice, is putting a pair of gloves on.  He then grabs the handles of a strange machin which emerges from the water and starts taking deep breaths, oblivious to the cold, his mind completely elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN LAB
dialogues.text: JOHANA watches JACQUES.  She just can't believe her eyes. LAWRENCE is bent over one of his machines, fiddling with different switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should get things moving, you know.  We're out of equipment and we can't do half of our experiments...! Frank, check the program! JOHANA is finally able to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who... Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayol... Jacques Mayol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the experiment?  Dumping a guy into a frozen lake? LAWRENCE turns one last knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The truck fell into a very deep crevasse.  We weren't able to save the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to talk to the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the spring when he melts! JOHANA walks closer to the window.  She isn't hearing a thing he's saying. JACQUES is putting on his flippers. JOHANA can't believe it. JACQUES is standing by a hole cut in the ice.  He is holding onto the machine in the water.  He is waving a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbfounded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really send him under the ice? He isn't a slave or a convict or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear, science is a cruel mistress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... how is he going to breathe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't going to breathe. JACQUES takes a deep breath, turns a handle and a weight yanks him straight down into the water.  LAWRENCE sets hi stop watch off and flips a few switches. JOHANA grabs his arm as if they could do something about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... He raises the volume:  we hear the man's heartbeat throug a small speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his heartbeat. (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear the speed at which it's slowing down, it's incredible. LAWRENCE tears off the sheet with the heartbeat measures on it and hands it to JOHANA. JOHANA feels she's on the verge of crying, and can't figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: JACQUES
dialogues.text: JACQUES stops his machine by turning one of the handles. He's deep beneath the surface of the frozen lake.  He swims deliberately, carefully into a large tube which is hinged open.  He closes it around himself.  His heart is still slowing down.  He pushes a button on the machine, and a flash of light bursts in the opaque night surrounding him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN LAB
dialogues.text: We see a moving X-ray image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the fluoroscope now.  Listen to his heart.  Impressive, huh?  The flow of blood is concentrated in the brain and doesn't even feed the limbs anymore.  It's a phenomena that has only been observed with dolphins... until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long can he stay down?  Without breathing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It depends.  He should come up soon. (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless he's decided to stay for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one thing, it's his job... as for the rest of it, I wish I knew. JOHANA sighs with relief as JACQUES appears at the surfac in one big breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't somebody take him a blanket or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee might be nice. She heads towards the Old Peruvian and pours a cup of coffee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (afterthought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he understand Spanish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother's an American.  He spent half of his life in the states.  I'd try English if I were you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's groggy, half hypnotized.  He looks up at the dock, sees JOHANA with a cup of coffee.  He stares at her.  She hands him the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw each other a little while ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wondering whether he is joking or not)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... in the hut. After a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a beautiful smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it was somebody that looked a lot like you... Thank you. JACQUES then turns around and walks toward the huts. JOHANA still hasn't moved, as if petrified by her emotion and the severe cold.  She then walks up to the hole in th ice and peers into the dark water.  She shudders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA emerges from a down sleeping bag.  She's wearing a big sweater and a wool hat.  She is not sleeping. Intrigued by the sound of the snowmobile, she gets up and walks over to the frozen window.  JACQUES and FRANK are loading their luggage onto the snowmobile. Outside, LAWRENCE is saying "Goodbye" to JACQUES.  Unseen JOHANA also waves from behind her curtain.  JACQUES sense something:  he turns around toward the cabin and smiles, waving his hand at JOHANA.  She hides behind the curtain and shyly waves back. JACQUES gets into the snowmobile and drives out of the frame.  We are left with an endless array of snow-caped mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fixed image of the Cote d'Azur.  The sparkling blue sea fades into the distance. A French taxi rides along the winding road overlooking th creeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind all his bags, JACQUES obsessively stares at the sea. The driver smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful, isn't it? JACQUES smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had some bad wind this week.  The "Mistral"!!  "Peuchere"!  There isn't one olive left on its tree. It suddenly left us this morning... I sure won't be the one to call it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi comes to a stop in front of Marineland.  JACQUES gets out, carrying one of his bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll only be five minutes. He enters Marineland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The park is closed, the paths are deserted.  JACQUES approaches the Dolphin's tank.  All three dolphins rise u in the water.  Greet him with a click and clatter of tongues.  JACQUES sits down at the edge of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, everybody!  Did you sleep well?  I slept in a plane, and it wasn't too great. He opens his duffel bag.  Hunts around, comes up with two packages wrapped in brownpaper.  The dolphins stare at him, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  presents. The dolphins CACKLE some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'd forget you? He laughs.  The driver, who seems to be quite familiar with the place, walks in heading straight over to the sod machine.  Out of the corner of his eye, he takes in the scene, very intrigued. JACQUES has not noticed him. He starts unwrapping the first package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Bathsheba. He produces a little ceramic Llama.

dialogues.speaker: ON BATHSHEBA
dialogues.text: looking at the llama, bewildered.  As bewildered as a dolphin can be.  JACQUES turns the llama upside down.  It moos:  HIAK, HIAK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Llama.  You understand?  From Peru.  It's fighting. BATHSHEBA shakes her head.  JACQUES throws the llama into the water.  He unwraps the second package.  A pair of Peruvian gloves and hat.  Wide eyed, the driver sits in the stands to watch the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for you, Darjeeling.  We wouldn't want you to catch cold! He throws them to DARJEELING who catches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now... (singing out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ta, da..." For you Tina. He pulls out a thermos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something you've never seen either. He opens the thermos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow! He sprinkles snow flakes on TINA'S head.  She tries to taste it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling like a child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new experience, Tina. (nostalgic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you little rascals.  Did you get my post card? The three dolphins leap into the air and land with a huge splash which soaks JACQUES.  He takes his shirt off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending to be serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?  Is that what you want? Alright, but five minutes, no more. I have a taxi waiting. He takes off his pants.  The taxi driver gets up, as if t keep him from going in.  JACQUES dives into the pool.

dialogues.speaker: ON JACQUES
dialogues.text: He swims under the dolphin, reaches out and grabs hold of the dolphin's snout. The dolphin pulls JACQUES around and around the basin while JACQUES pets his chest and belly.  We have never seen JACQUES so relaxed and happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overview of a gray and dirty Manhattan morning.  JOHANA depressed, stares blankly out of the window of a yellow cab.  She watches the muddy brown water flow under the Brooklyn Bridge. The driver keeps yelling obscenities to all the cars around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A suitcase in each hand, JOHANA gets out of the cab and walks up the stairs of her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA puts down her suitcase wearily.  Catches her breat and gets out her keys.  She tries one in the top lock.  I doesn't work.  She tries harder.  There's a woman's voice yelling angrily from inside the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed the lock you son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sally? The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're back!  Hello.  We were burgled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got the new T.V. JOHANA comes in, looks at the ransacked apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And the new stereo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope they remembered to take the microwave this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  How was your trip...?  Help me clean up, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to send detectives. When they get around to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, all they ever want is your phone number anyway. JOHANA goes over, slumps into an easy chair and sighs. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice... Very interesting... Great! (doubtfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Who'd you meet? JOHANA opens her handbag, takes out the strip of electrocardiogram paper, hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cardiogram...?  You met a doctor! Congratulations, you're in the chips... (an afterthought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless they have socialized medicine in Peru.  Do they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus...!  I'll make some coffee. (starts toward kitchen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They left the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room is almost completely put back together... SALLY is replacing books in the bookcase, JOHANA is using a carpet sweeper, and talking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonstop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6'3", 6'1", maybe 5'9" -- You can't be sure, you know the flippers, they add height or they take it away, or something.  Anyway short dark hair... Not punk or anything, just short. And the cutest smile.  He wasn't smiling at me, I don't think -- just smiling.  And he thought he saw me in the lake.  I mean that was a figure of speech... They're so romantic, the French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bored, half asleep)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said he was Peruvian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you been listening? SALLY opens the drapes, revealing it's dawn outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Since eight o'clock last night...!  You're in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a jerk. (emphatically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as love at first sight.

dialogues.speaker: SWIMMING POOL
dialogues.text: JACQUES is swimming alone at the bottom of a gigantic swimming pool.  He wears a monofin, his head and chest ar wired up to an assistant who runs back and forth alongsid the pool. A man's feet are seen walking over to the side of the pool. JACQUES is swimming laps, arching his body like a dolphin As he approaches one end of the pool, he sees a coin slowly falling in front of him.  JACQUES picks it up and looks at it:  it's an old Greek coin. JACQUES smiles and swims to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES pokes his head out of the water and pulls off his goggles. ENZO stands over him, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques, my friend, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo... A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I leave you swimming and twenty years later, you're still in the water!  What the hell are you doing? Training?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. An uneasiness sweeps over ENZO'S face and quickly disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. (smiling again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never would have recognized me, huh?  Check out the suit!  Looking good, no?  You know I'm the world champion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dove 315 feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say I'm like Lazarus.  You know, the guy who was raised from the dead?! He laughs.  JACQUES smiles.  ENZO goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't it surprise you that I just show up like this... Listen, the world championship starts in ten days in Taormina.  Be my guest. ENZO puts down an airplane ticket on the side of the pool

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ticket. Surprised, JACQUES looks over at the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm sure you're dying to beat me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be in any competition... I dive because I like to, not to beat a record... don't you have to be very mad at somebody to want to beat him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  All you need is to want to be the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the best, Enzo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a tense grin on his face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too easy!  Every time I beat a record there's always some dumbshit asking me:  "D'you know that French guy, Mayol?  He's supposed to be very good!  Too bad he doesn't compete." So, you're going to come with me to Taormina! First, because you're my friend and second, because you don't have one reason to keep on spoiling my pleasure. (he pushes the airplane ticket to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'll see you there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is seated across the desk from him.  He's reading through her report.  Behind him, outside the large plate glass window, window-washers are seated on a scaffold suspended far above the city.  They eat lunch. JOHANA'S eyes wander (bored) around the office as DUFFY reads.  He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating report)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good work... unfortunately it's incomplete. (he glances at the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you eat a sandwich 40 floors above the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johana, am I boring you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  Of course not, definitely not... well, maybe a little.  What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said that the file is incomplete. See if you can get through to this Lawrence character and have him send the Peruvian registration for his missing truck... and don't let him tell you it was in the glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right Chief! She starts out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the driver really freeze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a popsicle.  They're keeping him on a stick until spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!  I'm glad I didn't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath, leaving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor LAWRENCE covers one ear with his hand as he yells into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I said, all the truck papers are in the glove compartment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA sits at her desk, she too is yelling into the telephone.  Her colleague looks over at her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen, just get the custom's office to send me a copy as fast as possible.  We can't send you new equipment until our file is complete.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.  You'll have it by the end of the week, how's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made me a happy insurance person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, goodbye. He is just about to hang up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Professor...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes? JOHANA starts snooping around the papers on her desk, embarrassed by the presence of her colleague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as softly as possible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know how I could reach that diver of yours... Mayol... We need some additional information... I mean, we have a few questions to ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing I heard, he was off to Taormina for the world diving championships.  That's Taormina, in Sicily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA dashes in without knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I just found out we've got real problems in Sicily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (improvising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mafia!  La Cosa Nostra! Coppola!  De Niro...!  I knew it!  I knew we shouldn't have written that policy!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pale)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The documents are forged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  The notary is a phony.  He has the same signature as the contractor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fast talking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to send somebody over there immediately!  If we prove the forgery we can cancel the policy. We'll be off the hook.  There's a flight to Rome in two hours and from there its just a short hop to Sicily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send Cardoza, he'll be able to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried him, he can't go.  His son is being Bar Mitzvohed tomorrow... I'll go, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was Spanish that you spoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Italian is practically the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ferry comes into the dock, as a plank is slowly lowered As it descends, four rail cars lie in wait in its belly. JOHANA comes off the boat, carrying her suitcase, she wears a light summer dress.  She looks around, seeming a little lost. A white FIAT taxi screeches to a halt beside her.  JOHANA jumps.  The driver whose arm loosely dangles from the car window, grins at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Taxi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white FIAT taxi pulls up in front of the SAN DOMENICO hotel, but it is JACQUES who gets out of it.  The driver helps him with his bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking the books)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayol... Mayol... No reservation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive, Sir. JACQUES looks down at the piece of paper stapled to his ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the hotel San Domenico?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Sir, and it has been so for 127 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more and more uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but... So, you haven't got a room left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sir, the hotel is full because of the Diving championship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah?! The Receptionist starts working on his papers again. JACQUES, completely lost, stares blankly at the hotel clerk, wondering what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tiny FIAT clatters onto the sidewalk in front of the hotel narrowly avoiding the Countess' limo.  Parks its frontwheels on the sidewalk, rear end in the road. ENZO, followed by ROBERTO, get out of his car, like a kin descending from his carriage.  On the way, he stops and kisses a distinguished elderly woman's hand?  The hotel's CONTESSA. ENZO tosses his keys to a doorman who stepped up to complain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to doorman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful with that car, it's a new paint job. ENZO enters the hotel and sees JACQUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling across the lobby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giacomino!  My friend!  My brother! ENZO and JACQUES.  The two men kiss each other on both cheeks, pound each others back.  They are both moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you finally decided to join us? You did the right thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the desk clerk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Paolo!  Come stai?  Get my key! (to Jacques, gesturing over his shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember my little brother Roberto? Roberto (26) nods to JACQUES who shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember.  Hi Roberto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What room have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a room? (at the top of his lungs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paolo?  What did I just hear?  I personally called you to reserve a room for my good friend Jacques Mayol and you treat him like a stranger?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Enzo.  I'll go somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only is Jacques Mayol a very special friend, but he happens to be one of the best divers in the world! And you're throwing him out!  Are you crazy, or what?  Stupido!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really embarrassed now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo drop it, I'll find something. ENZO looks at him for a moment and gives him a warm smile He hands him his own keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take mine.  I'll take the Countess' suite.  She told me she was leaving for the cemetery... She'll be more comfortable there. PAOLO half-heartedly, hands him the key.  ENZO glances at JACQUES to make sure he's properly impressed.  He throws his arm around JACQUES' shoulder, hugs him and gives him real smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're at a table on a terrace that overlooks the sea. They've just arrived and all around them people are lunching away furiously. ENZO beckons to a passing WAITER who comes to the table. He's a very handsome, slightly effeminate young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Spaghetti del mare" (to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's delicious here.  It's the one thing they really know how to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del mare for two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sure, for two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a bottle of "Frascatti".  Two bottles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si Signore, grazie mille. The waiter hurries away.  ENZO watches his departure, the thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves just like a woman. (then, as if he were speaking to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be hard to live in two worlds like that, huh?  To breathe in one, swim in the other... JACQUES nods without really knowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway!  Nothing beats a sexy broad! Huh, Jacques! ENZO starts laughing.  JACQUES would like to crawl under the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their lunch is on the table, half eaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So, after all these years, you must have lots of questions to ask. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.  Lots of questions. JACQUES is satisfied with his answer.  He thinks that the subject is closed.  They eat silently for a moment.  ENZO watches him.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I don't know how to ask the questions. ENZO bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then.  I'll do the asking for you.  "Tell me dear Enzo, how did you become World Champion?"  Oh, that's a long story. (his voice changes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, after you left Amorgos, I went back to Italy and joined the Navy. So you now have in front of you -- Captain Molinari, who's been on leave of absence for the past 14 years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you make a living?  Your experiments, does it pay well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You married? JACQUES doesn't seem to have ever thought about marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither, 'cause of my Mother. She's a curse, my Mamma, a tornado. Stubborn as a mule!  I was engaged... for a week.  After that, Mamma was so mad, I tell you, pasta was bouncing off the walls. JACQUES smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, not married.  Well, good for you.  You play the field, like me. A girl in every port, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bluffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, I mean, after all, we're men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slapping the table top)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right!  That's what I tell them when people say you've turned into a fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sorry he went too far)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  I was joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA comes out of the stone tunnel which leads to the terrace.  She looks over the crowd, trying to find someone. JACQUES is sitting with his back to her.  She finally spots him and walks over to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh!  La Madonna!  This one is for me.  I'll bet you my watch that she's in my bed tonight. JACQUES turns around and recognizes her.  JOHANA smiles and walks up to the table.  ENZO takes his watch off and puts it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you she's mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo Molinari. ENZO kisses her hand and brushes his watch off the table in the same movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a great pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing at the protocol)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johana Cross, pleased to meet you. (then to Jacques, faking surprise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well!  Isn't this a coincidence.  I really wasn't expecting this... All the way out here.  It's incredible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I wouldn't want to interrupt anything. JOHANA sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're staying at the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish, but it's full.  They recommended a pension in town.  They say that all of Taormina is full. What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Free Diving World Championship.  I am by the way world champion! JOHANA has turned toward JACQUES, paying no attention to ENZO.  JACQUES can't stop looking at JOHANA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what brought you to Sicily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was doing an insurance investigation in Palermo. (to Enzo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work for an insurance company. (back to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I decided to take a few days off. (uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know this island at all.  It really is gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no place in the world more beautiful than Sicily! The waiter passes behind them.  ENZO reaches out, grabs him by the arm, pulls him to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spaghetti del mare for the super dedicated traveling insurance agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll have a coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  You'll like it.  It's superb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Okay.  I'll try. ENZO pours the wine. JOHANA shrugs fatalistically.  The waiter leaves. JACQUES, intrigued, stares at JOHANA.  She pretends not t notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you two meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have known. (to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I was telling you earlier, I'm the world champion free diver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people say it's the most virile sport in the world.  One has to admit that when you see those men diving head first in that deep blue sea, all muscles contracted in one super human effort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahi, ahi, cazzo!  Ma mamia! Where...?  God, she'll kill me... (pushing the plate in front of Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... if she catches me eating pasta in a restaurant. He quickly brushes off the crumbs in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: ON ENZO'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: heading toward them.  She's a huge woman in widow's black She shoulders her way through the tables. ROBERTO carrying her suitcases follows at her heels. ENZO jumps to his feet.  Throws his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Mamma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (expressionless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect me to carry all the luggage myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamma.  Roberto and an elevator... Isn't that enough? A beat.  Signora MOLINARI inspects the plates on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspiciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you been eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee only, I'm diving tomorrow. You remember little Jacques, Jacques Mayol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (timidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And his friend, Johana... Signora MOLINARI nods grudgingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arriving proudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spaghetti del mare! Dead silence. ENZO is the only one with no plate in front of him. Signora MOLINARI'S eyebrows condense into a dark stripe across her forehead. JOHANA hands ENZO'S plate to the WAITER and takes the ful one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And begins to eat, ignoring the expressions of amazement all around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Americana? JOHANA nods enthusiastically, her mouth too full to speak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed, to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benvenuto! MAMMA MOLINARI has a huge grin on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge onto the street in front of the entrance of a small rooming house. JACQUES is carrying JOHANA'S luggage.  The old pension is covered in bright pink bougainvilliers, there is laundry hanging on the other side of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for helping with the bag. (she looks up at the pension with little enthusiasm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was a nice place. (suddenly doubting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being a pain in the ass. (looking at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful here. They look at each other.  JACQUES is silent.  He just stands there, a suitcase in each hand. JOHANA breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be very busy these days aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because... I would have liked to visit the town... See the coast... I don't know anybody... Expect for you. (feeling she has gone too far)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you are going to be very busy. You must have tons of things to prepare, interviews... And a competition like this one must require a great deal of concentration, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head negatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Maybe... I don't know.  I don't like competitions... It ruins the fun.  Don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a faint smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess... But you know... I'm American and I've mostly been taught to be competitive... There's always pleasure of being the best?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe on earth there is one... but not when you dive... You see, to dive deep into the sea, for no reason... just to do it.  It's a feeling... I don't know how to say this... Voluptuous? He looks up at her as he pronounces the last word.  She smiles at him, lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can put down the suitcases, you know. He lets go of the suitcases.  Suddenly, behind them, ther is a loud screech of tires.  The FIAT tears across the street. ENZO in his FIAT.  He pokes his head out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you two... Jacques, we have to get ready for the ceremony tonight.  We have a new world champion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little tired, I don't know if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in front of a wardrobe looking JACQUES over in th full-length mirrors.  He's wearing an evening shirt and a tuxedo of ENZO'S.  The collar is too big, the sleeves hangover his hands.  He looks at himself dubiously in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberto!  The bow-tie! ROBERTO hands ENZO the bow-tie, he hooks it around JACQUES' collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a few steps back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. JACQUES looks down at his tennis shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very chic. (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, you don't have anything else, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, it's very chic.  Avanti!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big reception is organized on the terrace of the hotel. The official divers and technicians are all gathered in front of a podium.  The terrace is loaded with photographers. ROBERTO keeps turning round and round the long buffet table. JACQUES is alone at the bar.  Incongruous detail:  a whiskey bottle on the table beside him. JOHANA enters.  She has also had a few drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be at the dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too loud for me. He tugs at his over-sized tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Especially the sneakers. JACQUES looks down at his feet, doesn't know what to make of her comment.  JOHANA sits down beside him and pours herself a drink.  They touch glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the podium, NOVELLI, the organizer of the championship stands in his tuxedo, talking into a microphone.  An olde man in a worn out suit, stands next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, your attention, please.  Mr. Andre Bonnet, President of the International Diving Championship Committee, is going to present this trophy to the new world champion of free diving.  This afternoon, our new champion descended to the remarkable depth of 280 feet. The audience applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This young man Tia... NOVELLI can't quite read his notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiraro... Tirao-re... Moa... ANDRE BONNET takes his turn to read the note.  A young Tahitian jumps up, heads for the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiraero Moameora. NOVELLI hesitates to repeat the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Let's all give him a big hand. The audience cheers and applauds the new champion.  ENZO sits at a table, watching the ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A one day hero! He gets up and walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES and JOHANA are sitting at the bar.  The whiskeys have gone to their heads.  ENZO walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new world record!  That's great! It gives me something to beat tomorrow! (to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been to Tahiti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you there.  We'll live in the sun.  You'll cook fresh fish and we'll make love under the coconut trees. JOHANA smiles and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot the Hula!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, I'll do the Hula!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be lovely, but no thanks. (to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques, would you do a native dance for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how... Excuse me. JACQUES leaves the bar.  JOHANA watches him go.  ENZO notices her way of watching him.  He's a little jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks strange, doesn't he?  Like a baby that just learned to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you known him long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever.  We used to live on the same island in Greece, when we were kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was he like, when he was little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little.  Very little.  And skinny, very skinny too.  That is compared to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it, Enzo you were a superior child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly!  What is it Johana?  You're so crazy about him, you don't see the truth?! She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, don't think of Jacques as a human being.  He's from another world. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Italy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENZO sits at the grand piano in the corner of the terrace Beethoven was always a favorite of his. JACQUES, very tipsy by now walks over, a glass in each hand.  He hands ENZO a glass, then takes off his tennis shoes and sits them neatly on the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing like music.  It speaks from the heart.  Can you tell me why we bother diving in the dark, the cold, without ever taking the time to breathe?  Huh?  Can you tell me why we do it? JACQUES nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... For the mermaids. ENZO smiles, moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father used to see them everywhere too... but the only one he ever caught was my mother... Actually she caught him. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today at lunch, you asked me if I had any questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ha.  You finally want to know about women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Are they what's most important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... It depends... Sometimes they are... What, exactly do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... about everything. ENZO grins at JACQUES and starts playing again.

dialogues.speaker: JACQUES AND ENZO
dialogues.text: There are now several empty champagne bottles around. They are both quite drunk.  ENZO is philosophizing. JOHANA is looking for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So, between Mamma, Roberto and the sisters, we yell and scream all day long.  Except with Angelica. She just cries.  And then finally, we all end up kissing.  Can you explain that to me? JACQUES can't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's what love is all about.  It's a pain in the ass but keeps us together. (then, in a half dreaming, half desperate tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large and beautiful family! JOHANA walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo... We must quit the competition. ENZO hits a wrong note on the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't... I'm going to beat you. JOHANA stands next to JACQUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nervous laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  Well listen to him! (to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks me in the eye like some fuckin' gold fish, and says:  "I'm going to beat you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That's what he's here for, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to her!  "That's what he's here for"!  He's here to loose, that's what he's here for.  First of all, I'm unbeatable.  Second, how old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years younger than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I said, second of all you're too skinny.  You've got tiny lungs.  I still don't understand how you can dive without getting sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The size of the lungs has nothing to do with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me.  These aren't lungs. These are... Tanks.  How long can you hold your breath? ENZO is getting really angry.  The drinks have a lot to d with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Longer than you. ENZO pulls open his collar and rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: JACQUES and ENZO dive into the pool in their Tuxedos. Each one carries a beach umbrella in a concrete base to help them stay at the bottom. ENZO takes two goblets out of his pocket, hands them to JACQUES.  Takes a bottle of Champagne out of the other pocket and opens it.  The cork floats out of the bottle. Above on the surface of the pool there's a splash.  JOHAN finds a mask on the side of the pool and watches them. Her dress is soaked by now. ENZO pours champagne.  Courteous and grave, they clink glasses and begin to drink.  They have already been underwater longer than a minute.  They can't really drink out of the glasses and ENZO offers JACQUES the bottle. JACQUES studies the label like a connoisseur.  He drinks, passes the bottle back to ENZO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
