dialogues.text: Paramedics roll two stretchers toward the elevators at full speed.  ENZO on one, JACQUES on the other.  Both men keep throwing up water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paramedics roll the stretcher toward the bed. JOHANA very worried, follows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he's empty now.  He needs sleep, that's all. The two men leave the room. JOHANA walks over to the chair and rearranges JACQUES' shirt and jacket which the paramedic had thrown down. JACQUES looks like he's just had a very rough night.  He sits up and grabs the sides of the bed, as if he were on moving boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who won? JOHANA turns around, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won what?  The Ass Hole Award? Well, let me tell you, it's a tie! She walks over to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acting like a pair of two year olds! You could have died in that damn pool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please move slowly, you're rocking the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky I was there to save you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing her wet dress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You jumped in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only to help the medics, I assure you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wallet. JOHANA wet, walks over to the wet clothes on the chair. She pulls out JACQUES soaking wallet from one of the jacket pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still here. She tries to wipe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I want to show you.  Is it ruined?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, water isn't exactly the best thing for pictures... Not even for pictures of dolphins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me. JOHANA hands him the photograph.  He stares at it, lookin very sad.  Worried JOHANA sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the verge of tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My real family... (he looks at the picture and cries)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of man has such a family? She takes the picture out of his hands. He is so upset that JOHANA can hardly help from crying with him.  She sits next to him and strokes his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick of never feeling at home anywhere. JOHANA takes him in her arms.  He breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The early morning sun slowly lights up the water.  A yach has left the hotel dock.  It is moving out to sea off the coast of TAORMINA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Committee Boat for the diving competition. On the boat, ROBERTO is worried.  He checks his watch and finally decides to wake up his brother.  ENZO is asleep i the fore peak, curled up on a coil of line, snoring away. He wears his tuxedo jacket over a skimpy bathing suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo, wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulled from his dream)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh?  Si!  Avanti! He gets up on one arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The medics are looking all over for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm meditating, can't you see? Jacques does two hours of yoga before going down.  I can take a five minute nap, can't I? The boat stops.  The anchor is thrown over board. The sailors, technicians and officials are getting ready for the competition.  Today is ENZO'S turn to dive.  A ma is hooking a plaque indicating the depth (324 feet) onto lead disk which he heaves into the water on a cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A medic is bending over ENZO, taking his blood pressure. ROBERTO pulls the tuxedo jacket down.  The doctor puts a blood pressure band around ENZO'S upper arm, pumps it up. He listens with his stethoscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Molinari, I'm terribly sorry but I cannot allow you to dive in such an advanced state of exhaustion. ENZO jumps to his feet, grabs the doctor by his lapels, lifts him in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about the sea? Huh?  Nothing!  So you just put your tubes and tin cans away.  The sea is mine!  I know when she is ready for me and when she isn't.  And today, she is ready.  Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dive at your own risk.  You're been warned. ENZO smiles and pats the doctor on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a large float, rigged to the stern of the Committee Boat.  ROBERTO and an assistant help ENZO down the swim ladder to the platform.  He's wearing a wet suit and fins He flip-flops to the end of the platform. ROBERTO hands him his mask.  The goggles are filled with polystyrene to eliminate as much air pressure as possible Only two pinholes to see through.  The mask fits tightly over his nose.  When ENZO puts it on, he looks like an astonished insect.  ENZO breathes faster and faster. ROBERTO holds the wire controlling the weighted diving apparatus.  ENZO crosses himself, takes a last long gulp of air. ROBERTO releases the weight.  It sinks and drags ENZO down, he quickly disappears into the dark water...

dialogues.speaker: BLACK AND WHITE
dialogues.text: But this is JACQUES as he was a child.  He swims along th bottom, finds and picks up a gold coin.  We can see its ancient markings, a youth on a dolphin. JACQUES looks up.  In front of him is a dolphin, floating vertically, still, apparently just watching.  JACQUES isn't scared anymore.  But every time he swims toward the dolphin, it moves further away.  It finally disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits bolt upright in bed, awakened by his dream.  He looks around the room, trying to get his bearings. JOHANA is asleep in a chair across the room.  On the wall behind her, her last nights dress is drying on a hanger. She's wrapped up in a hotel bathrobe fast asleep. JACQUES finally awake from his dream, sees JOHANA sleeping.  He walks over to her, touches her shoulder. She wakes up, starts out of the chair.  She grabs the blanket to cover herself, and in doing so, a book falls o the floor.  It's one of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared me! JACQUES picks up the book.  JOHANA smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just checking up on your family. (then embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I was drunker than I thought and the idea of going back to my hotel in a wet dress... Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you stayed.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better get back now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... You wouldn't want to spend the day with me? She sits back in her chair, amazed that he would even ask

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self conscious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?  Huh? (she says "No" as if she had asked the question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES and JOHANA enter the dolphinarium.  JOHANA is wearing an old pair of JACQUES SHORTS along with an oversized T-shirt and rolled up sweater.  She seems quite pleased with her new attire. JACQUES and JOHANA walk straight through MARINELAND and head toward the dolphin pool.  It's pretty crowded, mostl kids. The dolphins are lying motionless at the bottom of the pool.  The trainer is tired of throwing fish in the pool and getting absolutely no reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.  We've tried for two days.  They won't eat.  They won't perform.  It's since we got the new one.

dialogues.speaker: DOLPHIN
dialogues.text: surfacing.  It thrusts its head over the edge of the pool looks to JACQUES and SPEAKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she the new one? Surprised, the trainer nods. JOHANA looks over at JACQUES then at the dolphin.  She doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you tell it's a female?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The way she moves. Three other dolphins gather around the one that JACQUES i patting. JACQUES is staring at the female dolphin.  It looks like the animal is trying to tell him something.  Suddenly the dolphin grabs him by the sleeve and pulls him into the pool.

dialogues.speaker: DOLPHIN POOL
dialogues.text: JACQUES hangs onto the dolphin's muzzle.  Let's it pull him along.  The dolphin swims to a far corner of the pool and pulls JACQUES to the bottom.  The other dolphins circle above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES pops up.  As he does, three dolphins leap in the air behind him.  JOHANA walks closer to the pool.  She is so excited by what JACQUES is doing, she finally falls into the pool. After a while, JACQUES gets out of the pool and helps JOHANA out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever think of trying the public pool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a dolphin specialist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case what's wrong with the new one?  Is she sick or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking his time to answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the way you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do?  Do I call the dealer...?  The investment, you understand... I certainly am entitled to complain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to cost you more than you think! JACQUES turns around and walks off.  JOHANA catches up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not like the others.  She can't stand to be away from the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I just feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES and JOHANA are walking across the corridor. ENZO walks up to them, followed by his tribe.  Everybody is congratulating him. ROBERTO is screaming, MAMMA MOLINARI is crying.  ENZO smiles as he talks back to them.  He sees JACQUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!  Jacques! ENZO grabs hold of his shoulders.  JACQUES and JOHANA are completely soaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sad, I only took back what was mine. He gives JACQUES the diving plaque, it reads 280 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, it's a present. JOHANA and JACQUES smile at each other.  JACQUES has won his bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Thank you. ENZO slaps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight we're having a little party among ourselves.  8 o'clock in my suite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. ENZO walks off then turns back toward them.  He whispers in JACQUES' ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me... Can you explain why you are soaking wet? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We're in training. ENZO walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three formally dressed officials are waiting in front of one of the hotel rooms.  One of them holds a medal in his hand, a glass of champagne in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Roberto, tell your brother to be reasonable.  Everyone is waiting for him upstairs.  The photographers are there, the press...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't, he's indisposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to keep his calm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we call a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay.  Mamma is going to try something. JACQUES and JOHANA walk up from the other side of the hal and stop in front of the same door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mayol, help us.  He refuses to receive his medal and everybody is waiting for him up there.  We already have problems with the press because of the danger, and if we don't even have the divers help...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dubious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'll do my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very kind of you. JACQUES knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jacques... Mayol! A beat.  Then ENZO opens the door himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques!  My friend!  Come on in! The officials look at each other baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Enzo Molinari, allow me to impress upon you the importance of your attending the Award Ceremony... For the press...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loosing his temper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my brother told you I was indisposed, that should do it, no? I'm allowed to be indisposed, right? So, you just tell the press that the "big" Enzo Molinari, overwhelmed by his inspiring descent to 324 feet, will not be able to receive this trinket because he is... He looks inquisitively at the three men.  ENZO looses his temper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he is?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Indisposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brave! He slams the door in their face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, why don't you go and get your medal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because pasta should be eaten "Al Dente".  So the trinket will just have to wait a bit. ENZO takes JACQUES by the shoulder.  Inside his room is absolute chaos:  dancing, singing, eating.  Wet suits hun out to dry everywhere.  MAMMA MOLINARI is whipping up mountains of spaghetti on an improvised stove in the middle of the room.  A lot of smoke... steam... color... noise... All of Italy crammed into a few square feet. JOHANA taken in by the warm atmosphere, sits in a corner of the room.  JACQUES walks over and sits down at her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mamma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamma!  La pasta?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrivo!  Arrivo! She points at ROBERTO who is taking forever to grate the cheese.  ENZO grabs the guitar from his other brother's hands and starts playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's easy.  You go down.  You come up. (to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Right, Johana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Enzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you agree, Jacques?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You always were the best. ENZO laughs then sees his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!  La pasta! ENZO starts singing in Italian.  MAMMA MOLINARI serves th pasta, ROBERTO follows her around, sprinkling his cheese on the plates.  She serves JOHANA a huge plate of pasta, enough for three giants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buon appetito, Signorina! JOHANA who isn't even hungry, grins uncertainly.  JACQUES has walked up to ENZO.  He doesn't dare ask his question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?  You still have a bunch of things to ask me?  You want to know the price of tea in China of how we landed on the moon?  Is that it? ENZO laughs.  JACQUES is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I have to ask you a favor... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one who'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tutto va bene? The three officials are eating pasta, plates on their knees.  Their mouths are too full to speak, they nod enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie mille, chignora. MAMMA MOLINARI smiles and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES is driving, JOHANA sits beside him.  ENZO crammed in the back seat, very uncomfortably, because of a stretcher which takes up all the space. They are dressed as they were at ENZO'S party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Will you slow down!  When did you learn how to drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving isn't the problem, it's remembering the right road. JACQUES runs a red light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the lights!  Running lights, stealing stretchers...!  You'll have us in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo, stop bitching, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out of the car.  JACQUES starts to change into his swimming trunks.  ENZO shakes his head, can't believe he's really come along.  He laughs and starts undressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very narrow street.  The car moves down it quickly JACQUES drives.  The back seat is now occupied by the dolphin.  Its nose and tail protruding through the windows. JOHANA is in the front seat, turned around, spraying the dolphin with a watering can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have driven to the public beach.  They slowly lower the stretcher into the water.  The dolphin, leaving the stretcher, swims around a little but won't go away. He won't leave JACQUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stay here!  Come on!  Go away! JACQUES swims off with her for a while. ENZO walks back toward the car with the stretcher. JOHANA, standing by the water looks at JACQUES and the dolphin who are swimming off together. JACQUES keeps splashing the dolphin as they swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop that now, she has all the water she needs. JACQUES cannot get rid of the dolphin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, we did it.  Let's go back to the party. JACQUES and the dolphin can't seem to part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one minute. JOHANA is worried, she walks up to ENZO who goes back int the water and takes JACQUES by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques, the dolphin is home now. And that's where we're going.  Come on!  Hurry up now.  Our girlfriend is freezing over there. The dolphin starts swimming off.  JACQUES follows ENZO half-heartedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENZO stops the FIAT in front of the pension.  The three o them get out.  ENZO hasn't bothered to dress. JOHANA heads for the gate, she obviously has no desire of leaving JACQUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good night, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to sleep here, all by yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... She looks over at the pension, having a hard time concealing her lack of enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's a comfortable place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sinister is what I'd call it...! Ours is so much cheerful!  Why don't you come and stay with me... There's plenty of room in my suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mamma's there too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (face clouds up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the Mamma is is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night Enzo, Good night Jacques.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need a stretcher to take her with you.  You know that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dolphins aren't the only ones who don't feel very good sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it alone, Enzo, it's okay. She rings the bell for the concierge, then looks back at JACQUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come watch you dive tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Yes, of course! The concierge comes out and opens the iron gate for her. JOHANA disappears into the parc.  ENZO turns to JACQUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really do have a few things to learn about women!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is rising on a rough sea.  The Committee Boat is anchored in the open sea, 600 feet above the sea bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES who is on the foredeck of a boat at sea has just laid a towel down before him.  He's suited up, sitting in the lotus position, staring straight ahead, clearly self- hypnotized. JOHANA, NOVELLI, and other officials are in the stern of the boat watching last minute preparations. The scuba divers in brightly colored wetsuits and aqualungs, flop out onto the diving platform, plunge into the water, disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're paramedics.  They wait at 180 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just checking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there was a problem, they could do something right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, that's what they're for. JOHANA sees scuba divers with weird air tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are the divers who go down 300 to 330 feet.  They dive with a Helium-oxygen mixture.  At that depth, compressed air is too dangerous because it contains carbon dioxide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that little air bottle on the machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That isn't for the divers actually. It's for the balloon.  It blows up and pulls the diver up like an elevator.  Without it, with the pressure at the bottom, the diver would just stay pinned to the sea bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But doesn't Jacques dive without anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... It's magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the boat, NOVELLI checks his watch.  JACQUES comes out of his room.  He's dressed to dive.  He ignores everyone as he goes down the ladder to the diving platform.  He seems to be in another world.  All sounds coming to him are drowned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES sits in the diver's slot.  Opens his eyes slowly and looks around.  He puts his flippers on, an assistant stands at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figures on the platform are vague, the VOICES are GARBLED and incomprehensible.  Moving almost in slow motion he raises three fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tre minuti!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Ten other divers have waited for this signal to dive. They disappear one by one into the blue. JACQUES uses contact lenses instead of a mask.  He puts them in, and now, his view of the world is as distorted a his hearing... bodies deform... sounds fade... Already euphoric from the vast amount of oxygen in his system, he moves into another reality altogether... seems to empty himself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Due minuti! JACQUES fills a small tube with water.  Pours it into his nostrils... tilts his head... then lets it run out... He puts on his gloves... all his movements are slow, he seem to be operating in a different time zone... He seems unable to take his eyes off the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uno minuto! JACQUES puts his nose clip on.  He puts his hand on the gueuse.  Closes his eyes and inhales slowly.  Then he takes a sudden last breath, nods, the technician releases the gueuse and in one flashing movement, he disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gueuse slides down the cable.  JACQUES hangs on like ribbon in the wind, past a marker, 90 feet down. Above him, the boat disappears from sight. He moves faster and faster... through a sea that looks like a cloudy sky.  The light fades rapidly around him. Below, white spotlights pierce an ocean dark as night. JACQUES reaches them in a matter of seconds.  Turns the brakes, brings his machine to a halt, 180 feet down. The medics are waiting for him there.  They take his pulse.  Check his eyes... 15 seconds... normal... the bubbles from there scuba tanks churn the water around them... JACQUES closes his eyes... a tap on the shoulder, he releases the brake on the gueuse.  Plunges further, this time into pitch black. Below him a faint spotlight glows on the bottom.  He reaches it and the dark diver moves to him.  JACQUES brakes his machine.  Moving very slowly, turns his body right side up.  Like a sleep walker, JACQUES starts to take the plaque off the plumbline... pauses in the middle of the gesture. The dark diver flashes the high sign to JACQUES, thumb an forefinger touching, fingers extended, all clear.  JACQUE does not respond.  The diver repeats the signal.  JACQUES does not respond. The diver taps JACQUES on the shoulder... a beat... and then JACQUES responds, thumb and forefinger touching okay Slowly, reluctantly, he wraps his hand around the handle of the balloon. The dark diver quickly turns the handle for him.  The balloon inflates.  JACQUES hangs on... lets it carry him up. At the plague marking 210 feet, JACQUES lets go of the th balloon.  With a burst of speed, it darts toward the surface. JACQUES follows slowly, undulating like a fish... He's getting warm now... He closes his eyes. Passes the medical control without stopping... without even seeing it like someone asleep. He's moving faster now, toward the warmth, toward the air JACQUES opens his eyes, watches the lights grow brighter. The silhouette of the boat comes back into view.  60 feet to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In slow motion JACQUES' hand holding the plaque breaks ou of the water followed by his arm, in one continuous movement, his shoulders and head. He gasps for air. A trickle of blood comes from his nose. Flashbulbs flicker, spectators cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dolphin, the one rescued last night, leaps into the air, in perfect harmony with JACQUES' triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dolphins in the dolphinarium leap into the air at the exact same moment. The trainer doesn't understand what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES falls back into the water.  Two divers run over and pull him up onto the dock. JACQUES seems completely dazed, almost in a trance.  He slowly comes to and starts screaming louder and louder. It is the scream of his body in need of the surface, reality and the feel of the land. JOHANA is terrified.  She can hardly breathe.  Everybody applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES and JOHANA walk down the gangway.  NOVELLI has lead the way and the news has been spread. JACQUES looks very weak and punchy. JOHANA holds him up. The spectators applaud as he goes by.  Intrigued, JACQUES looks at them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques, listen to the applause. He doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to keep up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques, you set a world record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you happy?  Don't you feel proud...?  I feel proud and all I did was watch. He is staring at her, he's returning to the real world. Slowly he smiles. She grabs hold of his arm and gives him a proud kiss on the mouth.  JACQUES is a little stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENZO walks into the hotel, his arms filled with packages. He sees JACQUES and JOHANA.  From the look on his face we can tell he knows that JACQUES has beaten his record.  He deliberately puts on a huge smile as he walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations Jacques!  It's wonderful!  Wonderful! He drops his packages on the bar and gives Jacques a big hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy for you! He kisses him and starts handing out his presents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... (to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little presents, nothing much... I knew it, I just knew it!  Look here! He holds up his arm:  he is wearing two watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberto's watch!  I won it!  He bet that you couldn't beat me! JACQUES opens his present.  It's a little ceramic dolphin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still collect them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have that one, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Thank you.  It's really beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's nothing.  I knew it.  I told Roberto "He's very good that little Frenchman, very good".  I lost my title but I won a watch! JOHANA has opened her package.  It's a big plate with a text engraved on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a poem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's the recipe for spaghetti "Frutti del mare". (to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see I was right in getting you out here.  You're a world champion, my friend! JACQUES has opened the last small package.  It's a measuring tape.  He looks at it without understanding. ENZO explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a measuring tape. He grabs hold of the tape and lets it roll to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see this is your record, three feet more than mine!  Looking at it from here, it doesn't look like much, does it? JACQUES looks at him without saying a word. ENZO hands him the measuring tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your little measuring tape, my friend, it will be a nice souvenir when I beat you next. ENZO taps his shoulder and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're locked in a long kiss.  He untucks the bottom of her shirt and slides his hands under it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in bed, making love in their fashion.  Moonlight shines in the silver sea.  In the background are the lights of the bay of TAORMINA.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: JACQUES is in bed with JOHANA.  They are both asleep. Suddenly, he sits up, as he always does after his recurrent dream. He's wide awake, looks over at her sleeping.  She sleeps peacefully like a baby.  Quietly, gently, he eases out of bed and walks to the open window. He stands on the balcony, staring at the sea.  Then in th distance in the moonlight, a dolphin leaps out of the water, once, twice, a third time. JACQUES laughs and goes back to the bed where he sits dow next to JOHANA.  She is still sound asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES quickly gets into one of his diving suits.  He puts on his flippers.  The dolphin is still jumping in an out of the water.  JACQUES jumps off the pier and swims over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA rolls over and feels the bed in her sleep. JACQUES' absence wakes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques? She gets up and walks over to the balcony.  She doesn't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA walks down the pier and notices the little pile of clothes JACQUES has left behind.  She looks around but still can't see anything.  She decides to sit next to the pile of clothes, and waits, her eyes riveted to the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky has just begun to light up again.  JOHANA is stil sitting next to the pile of clothes. She is wearing JACQUES' sweater.  She looks sad, yet serene.  The look of a woman who has been thinking over the situation and who has made up her mind. Tired, JACQUES swims back to the pier.  It looks as if he has come out of nowhere. He is exhausted.  He takes off his flippers and gets up onto the pier in front of JOHANA.  He looks at her, a little surprised to find her there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? She answers in a far away voice, with the same serene sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to leave, Jacques. Dripping with water, he sits down next to her.  His face is drawn from fatigue.  She continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because one shouldn't fall in love with creatures from the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not from the sea... I don't understand what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do.  You know exactly what I'm talking about.  You're afraid I want to hold onto you, and I do, but you're not ready... at least not for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not true, I feel good with you... It feels right... She looks at him for a moment, then takes his face in her hands and rests it on her bosom, as if a small child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get back to the hotel... and get my suitcase packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train station faces the sea.  JACQUES and JOHANA are standing on the platform, amid others.  In the distance w hear the rumble and whistle of a train. JOHANA gets on the train.  The station master blows his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will... will we see each other again? JOHANA'S eyes are filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take good care of yourself, Jacques. The train starts pulling out of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can I call you?  Johana, tell me where can I call you? JOHANA doesn't answer.  JACQUES stands helplessly in the station, his eyes filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENZO opens the door of his suite.  His hair is messed up, he's got "sheet prints" on his face and is wearing the to of a diving suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, I enjoy talking in my sleep. ENZO walks back into the apartment and crashes on the bed He's lying on his stomach.  JACQUES walks in and lets himself drop in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake me up at 11:00. ENZO closes his eyes.  JACQUES looks over at the clock, i says 11:25.  JACQUES doesn't say anything and stares blankly out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening one eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm!  Something wrong? JACQUES doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it the girl? JACQUES stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she leave? No answer.  ENZO gets up and sits on the side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  I'm going to take care of you! I've got this job, on an oil rig, no sweat!  I'm taking you along... Come on!  Get your bags packed!  You're coming with me, I tell you! He pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make a great team, the two of us.  You'll see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The platform shines in the morning light. There are several stories of crew housing and offices above the deck.  Long steel legs disappear into the swelling slate-gray ocean.  We hear WHOP-WHOP-WHOP of a helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter is landing.  Crewmen rush to secure it to the oil rig's deck.  Doors open and two passengers get off:  JACQUES and ENZO.  They each carry a duffel bag of personal belongings.  They're both wearing fluorescent diving suits. The DRILLING SUPERINTENDENT comes to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayol, Molinari...? They nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been waiting for you for three days.  Goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the way you talk to the best diver in the world...?  And to his friend Jacques Mayol! The SUPERINTENDENT smiles sourly, and gestures to a crewman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show them their quarters. Five minutes later, JACQUES and ENZO are following the crewman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what!?  His job is to hand out the paychecks.  And he does that very well, let me tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diving capsule, suspended by cables, begins its descent through a trap door in the deck.  It plunges into the sea. The three men in the capsule are:  JACQUES, ENZO and the tough looking CAPSULE COMMANDER NOIREUTER, who is much to professional for ENZO'S tastes. ENZO watches through a porthole while the COMMANDER concentrates on the control console.  He runs through a checklist of systems.  JACQUES responds with a "check" as he verifies each one.  ENZO is already bored and fed up b the procedures. JACQUES is lost in thought, they don't look cheerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still thinking about her? JACQUES doesn't answer.  ENZO goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think about her anymore!  Let me tell you, you're just making yourself unhappy!  There are so many women in the world! He takes a cigarette from a pouch in his diving suit and stares at NOIREUTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plenty of women everywhere right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoking is absolutely forbidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't lit yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't even carry cigarettes on board!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen we're not supposed to piss either but that doesn't stop you from carrying "it" on board?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stubborn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rules are the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking out this creature)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What's your name again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noireuter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where did you say you were from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say... (contemptuous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brussels! ENZO smiles sardonically, shaking his head very slowly. The COMMANDER'S answer explains it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A technician is overlooking the capsule descent on a video screen. The SUPERINTENDENT watches over the technician's shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're at 450 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENZO, a cigarette dangling from his lips, looks through the porthole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I was seventeen, I loved her so much I tried to die for her.  Two years later I couldn't even remember her name!  Let me tell you, time erases everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to erase anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd rather think about it and make yourself miserable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after thinking about it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you this.  You're stubborn... Dumb, but stubborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it as a compliment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The technician fiddles with a few knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minus 800 feet.  End of descent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diving capsule ends its descent.  The COMMANDER turns to ENZO and JACQUES who is still staring out the porthole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a Mickey Mouse voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have enough air for 15 minutes. ENZO bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with Donald Ducks voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the voice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing.  It's just the helium, because of the air pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... does the voice come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For others, yes... For you, who knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still a little worried, to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try speaking to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with Daffy Ducks voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't find this funny.  We were having a serious conversation. ENZO and JACQUES burst out laughing.  They keep these sam voice till the end of the scene. ENZO pulls out a tiny silver flask out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, give me your finger. ENZO taps a drop onto JACQUES' finger, then on his own. Then NOIREUTER blows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a panic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that alcohol?  Are you out of your mind?  Alcohol is strictly forbidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loosing his temper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  D'you have any other complaints?  Just make a list and we'll stick it on the porthole! Okay? ENZO pours a second drop on his own finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, suck your finger. JACQUES hesitates.  ENZO has no qualms about it and sucks his own finger.  NOIREUTER is petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?  At this pressure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very deep down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, suck your finger, you'll be seeing mermaids everywhere! JACQUES, convinced sucks his finger too.  ENZO smiles. The alcohol has an immediate effect on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand commanders and we get a Belgian from Alcoholic's Anonymous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENZO gets out of the diving capsule, head first. He is connected to the capsule by a number of cables. JACQUES, who follows him, gets completely tangled up in them.  They are both hilariously drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUPERINTENDENT hears them laughing through the contro room speakers.  He flips a communication switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me?  What's going on? (to the technician)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're on the right channel? The technician nods back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two divers have gotten to the spot they are supposed to be working on.  They have their arms around each other and are dancing. NOIREUTER watches them through the porthole.  He shakes his head in complete disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the two friends humming the tune of a Viennese waltz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If those guys are playing a radio down there they'd just better watch out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY is talking away, pointing around the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And if we repaint the walls, we'll need new curtains, you put the painters on you Visa and I'll do the curtains on American Express... for the couch there's Bloomingdales... or are you still over your limit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way past it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that have a hidden meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm just depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look it too.  You haven't been working out, you haven't been taking your vitamins!  You haven't been drinking your herbs, you haven't been...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know!  I'm a terrible person... (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... I'm so damn, damn sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it honey... the frenchy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I should have stayed? Don't you think maybe I should have stayed?  I've been a jerk, right? (then, emphatically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have stayed!  I was supposed to be in love... I was in love!  I am in love, why did I act like a bitch?  He went swimming. All the man did was go swimming!  I must be crazy.  It was too good to be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitamins, exercise, herb tea... and see a doctor, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor enters with a folder, speaks to JOHANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Miss Cross, herbs aren't going to do the trick this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's serious, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.  You're pregnant... Congratulations!  If that's in order? JOHANA breaks into a wide grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in order!  Thank you.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's me you have to thank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUFFY is at his desk.  His lunch is spread out in front o him.  Outside the window, the window-washers are eating their lunch too.  JOHANA hurries in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to make a clean breast of everything... the whole business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bluffing, with his mouth full of sandwich)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Of course.  Very wise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a rush)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when I went to Italy and canceled the policy on the new stadium.  Well, we weren't being cheated by the Mafia or anybody except maybe by me... (she sees the window- washers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Do they come for lunch everyday? I really went on my own business, to see a man that I happen to be in love with... and I'm glad I did it, but I'm sorry about the policy and I'll be happy to make up the money the company didn't get... of course just now I don't have... (she checks a note she's holding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One million, four hundred and ten thousand dollars.  But if you were to dock my salary, say, twenty dollars a week, in a few hundred years we'd be even... and I think this is where you fire me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing sandwich)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will that interfere with my getting maternity leave?  I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Italian, I presume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He's French, he was just in Italy for the competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems to have won it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, isn't it wonderful?  I'm so happy.  I'll bet I'm the happiest pregnant fired person in the world! She starts to leave... calls out to the window-washers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon appetit and Adieu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA stares out of the bay window of her Manhattan apartment.  Hesitant, she walks around her telephone. Finally she makes up her mind, picks up her address book and dials the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me... Johana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES is on the telephone, in front of a little window overlooking the sea.  He is very glad to hear her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That's funny... I had this job with Enzo... we got fired too. JOHANA'S face lights up with a huge smile.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: JOHANA is still on the phone, sitting in front of the bay window.  Day is dawning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out at the skyline)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting light out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, it's getting dark. JOHANA smiles.  She stretches, lies down on the carpeted floor.  JACQUES seems to have gone through all topics of conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about you a lot, you know... JOHANA is by now completely stretched out on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have I. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, talk to me some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's hard you know.  You're so far away and I don't know what else to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, tell me a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Ah!  A story? He turns around and sits on the window sill, his feet dangling in mid air. He looks at the sea, seeking inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how it is? (starting again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what you're supposed to do to meet a mermaid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go down to the bottom of the sea, where the water isn't even blue anymore, where the sky is only a memory... and you float there, quietly, quietly and stay there... and you decide that you will die for them... Only then do they start coming out.  They come and greet you and they judge the love you have for them... If it's sincere.  If it's pure... They will be with you and take you away forever. JOHANA listens with the abandon of a child being put to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun hits the roof tops.  The sea is sparkling. The phone rings on the window sill.  JACQUES answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me again. JACQUES smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being a pain, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  In that case... I'm at the airport in Nice. JACQUES doesn't know what to say.  He looks around him, can't figure out what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... huh, I'll be right over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA is standing in front of the airport. JACQUES sees her.  They smile shyly at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES and JOHANA are sitting in the back of a taxi.  Th driver stops in front of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Carlton!  Enjoy your siesta. JACQUES and JOHANA look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is in semi-darkness, despite the blazing sunligh coming through cracks in the shutters.  JACQUES and JOHAN are making love.  JACQUES is on top of her, his whole bod covered in sweat.  The rumpled sheets and the movements o their bodies suggest the movements of the sea.  ALL SOUND are disproportionate and slightly distorted, they are underwater... ALL JOHANA'S reluctance has vanished.  Both of them act like people who have never felt anything like this before A certain astonishment at the depth of their feeling.  An increasing freedom.  All the muscles of their bodies stretch to their limits. JACQUES, progressively, finds himself disappearing.  His image dissolves point by point... disintegrates into unbroken blue... The effect creates the impression of someone melting, the screen is now totally blue. A thin, HIGH-PITCHED SOUND. From the bottom of the image, a tiny pinpoint starts TOWARD the CAMERA.  It is JACQUES, naked, swimming out of the deep blue ocean toward the light as if he were coming out of a dive.  He comes CLOSER and CLOSER to the CAMERA... Until his head almost touches the lens... A sudden DEAFENING NOISE... and we find JACQUES on top of JOHANA.  He looks down at her, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? After a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I think I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES and JOHANA step out of the elevator of a 19th century building. JACQUES is carrying her suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you take me to the hotel, if you live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll understand. JACQUES rings the door bell and sticks his key in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone in there? JACQUES nods and pushes the door open with the bags he's carrying.  They enter a huge, very old apartment filled with models and paintings of boats. JACQUES leads JOHANA to the other end of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a huge old-fashioned bathroom.  The centerpiece is a deep ancient bathtub on faded gild feet.  There's a rippling shadow of a body under the bath water. JOHANA gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid.  It's my Uncle... Louis. He goes to the tub and pinches the end of a tube.  UNCLE LOUIS, underwater, has been breathing through it.  LOUIS' head pops out of the water, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assassin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud, as if speaking to a deaf man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Louis, this is my friend Johana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you buy the cassettes?  The Wagner, the Berlioz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought Johana to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?  I have no use for a woman!  Since my accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  Johana is visiting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonjour Monsieur... Louis. (she looks to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Louis.  He's a 75 year old amazing guy, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very pleased to meet you, Uncle Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring the cassettes, the Wagner, the Berlioz? (pointing to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This idiot never listens to anything I say.  Sometimes I wonder if he isn't deaf. LOUIS climbs out of the bathtub, and pulls on a bathrobe. Behind him he's pulling two insulated wires out of the bathtub.  We see that they're connected to small underwater speakers.  As they surface, incredibly LOUD MUSIC BLASTS:  the finale of the "1812 Overture", (trumpets, timpani, cannons, etc...) The sound fills the room, the apartment, and probably all of ANTIBES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them are at the table.  There are a few scraps on their plates on a threadbare lace tablecloth. Incredibly LOUD SYMPHONIC MUSIC is PLAYING.  LOUIS is as deaf as a fence post. Everyone has to scream over the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from, Henrietta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johana... New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of name is that?  To be named after a city?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't hear too well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I was from New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling at Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That explains it!  The best lays are from New York!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Louis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  It's true.  When I was in New York, oh boy! (to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before my accident, you understand? (then back to Jacques)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES stands up and lowers the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Louis!  Johana is my friend. She's come to stay with me for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  That way I'll see more of you... Where are you going to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar!  Thief!  Torturer!  When you were an orphan I nursed you at my breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Louis, we have a guest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to put a lock on the telephone. (them calming down, to Johana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring the cassettes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES' room looks like a diving equipment storage room with a bed in it.  JACQUES notices JOHANA'S gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solicitously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it'll be all right? You'll be comfortable here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be... interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACQUES, JOHANA and ROBERTO are waiting at the port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's not like him to be late. Of course sometimes he doesn't show up at all.  Once in Capri, he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get the picture, Roberto. (looks over her shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques, I think Louis needs help. JACQUES turns around.  UNCLE LOUIS is a few yards behind them at a fish stand on the dock.  He's holding up an eel and screaming at the fishmonger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dollars for this!  This fish wasn't caught.  It died of cancer! JACQUES shrugs his shoulders and gives up on the idea of interfering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he comes! A speed boat races along the water.  It's a beautiful highly-varnished mahogany Riva.  It races into the port. Standing at the helm, looking like Christopher Columbus his hair brushed back by the wind, is ENZO. Next to him hanging on to the windscreen is an impressive six foot, dark haired beauty.  She has a scarf over her hair.  She wears a purple leather micro-mini with a ceris halter top and her ruby fingernails are three inches long If she ever actually would get cast in a movie, she'd mak Raquel Welch hide in shame.  Her stage name is BONITA MARIPOSA. ENZO kills the THROTTLE, swings the speedboat into a perfect landing at the dock.  ROBERTO takes the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacques!  Johana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo! During all of this, everyone's attention is actually on BONITA who is tugging at her long black hair.  They're al awestruck except for ROBERTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning the speed boat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning Bonita)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That"!  This is not a "that"... This is Bonita Mariposa, the famous Spanish actress. (whispering to Bonita)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Who is going to be careful with the varnish... (back to Roberto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who has come to spend a few days with us. (and very quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mamma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have eight hours before she gets here. ENZO glances at his watch and sighs with relief.  BONITA says hello to JACQUES, kisses JOHANA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud classical music booms from the stereo.  The noise pins JACQUES, ENZO and ROBERTO to their chairs. UNCLE LOUIS gets a bottle of whiskey and serves everybody

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really going totally deaf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not as deaf as you are blind, my boy!  You take care of your eyes, I'll take care of my ears!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Uncle Louis. UNCLE LOUIS pours him a whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, drink up, my boy!  It might just save us from your bullshit. The bottle is empty.  UNCLE LOUIS goes to the kitchen. JACQUES turns down the music, and finally hears the bell which has been ringing.  JACQUES opens the apartment door it's Professor LAWRENCE.  Suit and tie and carrying a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you could come.  I want you to meet Enzo. ENZO and LAWRENCE shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the famous Enzo Molinari?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with an even bigger smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the flesh.  I have that honor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA comes into the bathroom, closes the door, cutting down the blaring music.  The paint is peeling off the ceiling. BONITA is standing under a 40 watt lamp, putting on make- up in front of JACQUES' cracked shaving mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to live here permanently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Maybe, if Jacques will let me fix up the place a little. JOHANA walks over to the mirror and watches BONITA put on her make-up like a professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's shy, not like Enzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Not like Enzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting on eyelashes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think, he's really nice... He's a funny guy... sometimes even very moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm pregnant, Bonita! BONITA stops working on her make-up and looks pensively a JOHANA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to keep it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should talk to him about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... I just don't know how to... BONITA looks at her with the same pensive look. JOHANA goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of something kinda stupid last night.  You know those women in the greek mythology that made love with the Gods.  Take Leda for example, sleeping with Jupiter, who came to earth as a swan... Well, can you imagine Leda announcing to her swan "You're going to be a father, my little chick-a-dee"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your man isn't quite a God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not, but I still don't have the nerve to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're going to have to tell him, sometime! Unconvinced, JOHANA nods.  She changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you...?  Do you love Enzo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (earnestly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very much, I think. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, there's going to be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "problem":  MAMMA MOLINARI sits between ENZO and ROBERTO, looking like a malevolent storm cloud, staring across at BONITA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamma, calimari fritti... Zuppa de pesci.  Sono buoni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing Bonita)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I'm not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamma, Bonita is an actress like Sophia Loren, Anna Magnani...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah Bernardt.  I sing too... a hell of a Carmen.  Want to hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you. There's an interminable awkward silence.  Then UNCLE LOUI at last finds his way to the table.  JACQUES who is too grateful for the interruption springs to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Louis, you remember Enzo's mother Signora Molinari from Amorgos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whale!  How could I forget? Always was something fishy about that woman! MAMMA MOLINARI is having trouble breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were Italians doing living in Greece anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis, we were French!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's different!  What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (complete panic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mamma, pesce di spada? All of them are gasping for air, trying so hard not to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mamma)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, whale!  Can you pass down the squids? They all burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diving platform is out.  The competition has begun. ENZO is at the gueuse, getting ready to dive.  ROBERTO works around him busily. BONITA on deck above him is making little gestures of encouragement.  ENZO isn't amused. Other competitors watch from the Committee Boat. ENZO turns the handle on the gueuse, plunges into the water. Professor LAWRENCE, taking notes, stands a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: ON ENZO
dialogues.text: He dives down, further and further down.  He approaches the two medics in aqualungs at the control point (210 feet). They move toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surfacing.  Assistants help him onto the platform. ROBERTO pulls off his fins.  ENZO rips off his mask.  He looks furious.  He tosses the depth plaque (which proves he is qualified) back into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shit dive. He looks around angrily for an official.  Sees NOVELLI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those goddamned frogmen doctors waiting around at 200 feet they just kill your concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're required by law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (climbing off platform)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no law down there!  The only law is what your lungs can take. (to the next diver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Have fun!  They waiting for you down there, to take the temperature of your ass. He keeps on walking across the boat, runs into JACQUES, who's just about to begin his yoga preparation. JACQUES sees ENZO'S expression, looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody can have a bad day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had many... when the sea doesn't want you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never the sea!  It's Roberto, Mamma, that stupid actress... Oh shit!  Jacques, what do you know? Go do your Hindu exercises and don't break my balls! ENZO stamps into one of the cabins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA is reading a child birth catalog.  She throws it away upside down, as soon as she hears JACQUES approaching.  JACQUES comes in and sits opposite her.  He seems bitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how was it? In an involuntary gesture, JACQUES flips through the catalog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo had a bad day. JOHANA wonders if JACQUES will understand the presence of the baby magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't dive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she takes the magazine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll try again tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... it didn't feel right.  I'm going to bed.  I'm tired. He goes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot your magazine! He hasn't heard. JACQUES goes to the bedroom, and throws himself on the bed. JOHANA looks as if she had wished he'd put two and two together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENZO bursts out of the water.  He rips off his face mask, throws it on the diving platform, roaring with pleasure. He tosses the depth plague to ROBERTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHANA opens the apartment door.  BONITA is standing there, a suitcase in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to say goodbye, Johana. They kiss each other goodbye. JOHANA is very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... (she hands her a note)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you please give this to Enzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. BONITA grabs the note back and tears it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use... Just tell him I said goodbye... And give him a kiss for me, Okay? The two women hug again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sorry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonita, you shouldn't be discouraged so easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have the strength to fight off la Mamma... Anyway who wants to spend their whole life waiting at the end of a pier. BONITA rests her hand on JOHANA'S stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet... I'm waiting for the right moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You take care of yourself, Johana. BONITA smiles at her and disappears down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officials, NOVELLI, LAWRENCE, ROBERTO and of course ENZO disembark.  There is a lot of excitement on the dock. Everyone has already heard the news. People swarm around ENZO. LAWRENCE spots JACQUES in the crowd, and goes to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really was unbelievable, 328 feet, deeper than the world record... (then eagerly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And, Jacques!  He held his breath for four minutes and fifty seconds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles too)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... I guess I have tomorrow's work cut out for me as Enzo would say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be very careful, Jacques. At these depths, to hold your breath for over five minutes is... You'd really be pushing it.  I think it's very, very dangerous. JACQUES sees ENZO being carried past on the shoulders of the crowd.  He ignores LAWRENCE, runs beside ENZO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enzo, Enzo!  Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in answer to the crowd's applause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you very much! ENZO and NOVELLI stand on a little stage facing the crowd ENZO is holding a gold trophy, waving to friends in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Now I'm sure you've heard that some people have suggested it is too dangerous for us to continue. Dangerous, because we don't know how to measure the physiological consequences of this type of dive and also because the scuba divers are not used to going down below 300 feet. While the attentive crowd listens to NOVELLI, ENZO is gesturing to ROBERTO, explaining what appetizers he wants from the cocktail trays. The crowd laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, we polled the free divers and they insist that the competition continue! There's wild applause.  ENZO lifts the trophy over his head, smiles like a champ and yells into the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck to you all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENZO and ROBERTO are on the front deck watching the divers. A German diver comes up to the surface, empty handed. ENZO smiles. The Tahitian comes out of the water in a semi-coma.  The doctors carry him away.  Once he's sure that the diver is out of danger, ENZO smiles again. A whole team of Japanese walk over to the diving platform The team consists of one diver and six assistants, three of them playing music to help the diver concentrate.  The diver wears a white wet suit with a red circle on his forehead.  He is concentrating very hard, so much that ENZO walks over to him to make sure he's okay.  The Japanese diver concentrates with such strength that he faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling to his brother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabulous, what a dive, huh? ROBERTO smiles. The diver from the Philippines stands at the end of the diving platform.  He concentrates for a moment then gives up and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.  What's the point of knocking yourself out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in bed, side by side, both of them half asleep. The only light in the room comes from the open windows. He rolls over and watches her sleep, looking down at her adoringly.  He slips off the chain with the gold coin. Slowly, holding the chain, he runs the coin gently over her body, stops at the level of her stomach and lets it rest there.  She opens her eyes and looks at him, wondering if he senses something.
